question: 5 (b)
statement_html: Suppose that p is a prime with \(\displaystyle p \equiv 3 \mod{4}\). Show that there is no solution to the congruence \(\displaystyle x^2 \equiv -1 \mod{p}\).
statement_latex:
Suppose that \emph{p} is a prime with
$\displaystyle p \equiv  3 \mod{4}$. Show that there is no solution to
the congruence $\displaystyle x^2 \equiv -1 \mod{p}$.
statement_raw: Suppose that ''p'' is a prime with <math> \displaystyle p \equiv  3 \mod{4} </math>. Show that there is no solution to the congruence <math> \displaystyle x^2 \equiv -1 \mod{p} </math>.
